note.title: Actions to perform
note.p:
You can use the following actions:
none: no action
dump: stores the content of the mail to a file located in the directory specified with the mail_file_directory argument with the messageId of the mail being used as the file name.
dump_attachments: stores the attachments of the mail to files located in the directory specified with the in mail_attachments_directory argument.
With the attachment_file_name_pattern argument you can specify the file names.
With the body_as_attachment argument you decide if the mail body should be handled as an attachment and should be stored too.
You can concatenate actions by using a semicolon ";".
